content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>RSP Papers</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/366" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle>Papers published by the RSP project</subtitle> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/366</id> <updated>2015-03-07T05:49:01Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-07T05:49:01Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>Working together for the greater good: the mutual benefits to be gained from engaging with your institutional repository project</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/564" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Bailey, Steve</name> </author> <author> <name>Knowles, Jackie</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/564</id> <updated>2008-05-06T14:46:06Z</updated> <published>2008-07-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Working together for the greater good: the mutual benefits to be gained from engaging with your institutional repository project Bailey, Steve; Knowles, Jackie </summary> <dc:date>2008-07-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Class of 2007: The Repositories Support Project Summer School</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/325" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Knowles, Jackie</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/325</id> <updated>2007-08-20T09:39:35Z</updated> <published>2007-07-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Class of 2007: The Repositories Support Project Summer School Knowles, Jackie The Repositories Support Project (RSP) is a major initiative from JISC to support the development and growth of the repositories network in the UK. With its first major event the RSP team offered 23 prospective and new repository managers from Higher Education institutions across the UK the opportunity to participate in an intensive 48-hour repository summer school. Held at the inspirational and delightful Dartington Hall in Devon, this three-day residential course delivered a comprehensive overview of the practical challenges and solutions to effective repository implementation. </summary> <dc:date>2007-07-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Repository presentations from Gregynog colloquium 2007</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/312" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Knowles, Jackie</name> </author> <author> <name>Lewis, Stuart</name> </author> <author> <name>Yates, Chris</name> </author> <author> <name>Hubbard, Bill</name> </author> <author> <name>Bell, Anne</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/312</id> <updated>2014-10-22T11:36:18Z</updated> <published>2007-06-26T13:14:03Z</published> <summary type="text">Repository presentations from Gregynog colloquium 2007 Knowles, Jackie; Lewis, Stuart; Yates, Chris; Hubbard, Bill; Bell, Anne </summary> <dc:date>2007-06-26T13:14:03Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Institutional Repositories: The New University Challenge</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/308" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Pennock, Maureen</name> </author> <author> <name>Lewis, Stuart</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/308</id> <updated>2007-05-05T01:00:24Z</updated> <published>2007-04-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Institutional Repositories: The New University Challenge Pennock, Maureen; Lewis, Stuart </summary> <dc:date>2007-04-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
